posts.post_content: Often times "gothic horror" can be used to describe far more than just Dracula and Frankenstein style horror. The idea of an animal like a pig, some lowly farm animal growing to an immense size and going berserk could be described as Gothic, finding horror within something you see so often you'd expect to be used to it. I know i'd be scared if some giant pig that eats houses turned those creepy pervy giant pig eyes on me!
posts.html:
Often times "gothic horror" can be used to describe far more than just Dracula and Frankenstein style horror. The idea of an animal like a pig, some lowly farm animal growing to an immense size and going berserk could be described as Gothic, finding horror within something you see so often you'd expect to be used to it. I know i'd be scared if some giant pig that eats houses turned those creepy pervy giant pig eyes on me!

posts.post_content: As with many green creatures in Innistrad block, I'm not really sure how this guy fits into the flavor of the setting. We've got gothic horror, angels and demons, and... a random giant pig. Why?
